[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Protocol: Malleability] Can an attacker modify encrypted shares in transit such that they correspond to a different InputSecret, breaking transcript binding? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Protocol: Forward secrecy] If an InputSecret is compromised, can past DKG transcripts be decrypted retroactively, violating forward secrecy? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Protocol: Verifiable randomness] Can validators prove they generated InputSecret randomly, or can malicious validators use biased secrets to influence the final shared randomness? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Struct: InputSecret] [Input validation] Does InputSecret validate that field element 'a' is in the valid range during construction, or can out-of-range values be injected? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Function: generate()] [Error handling] Does generate() properly handle RNG failures, or can RNG errors result in deterministic or predictable secrets being generated? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Function: add_assign()] [Panic safety] Can add_assign() panic due to field operation failures, causing DoS during secret aggregation in the DKG protocol? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Function: to()] [Conversion failure] Can the Convert::to() implementation fail silently or produce incorrect results when public parameters are invalid? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Function: is_zero()] [False negatives] Can is_zero() return false for mathematically zero values due to floating-point-like precision issues in certain field implementations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Security: Constant-time operations] Are all operations on InputSecret constant-time, or can branching on secret values create timing side channels observable by attackers? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Security: Cache timing] Can cache line access patterns during InputSecret operations leak information about secret values through cache timing attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Security: Power analysis] Can differential power analysis attacks on hardware running DKG operations extract InputSecret values through power consumption monitoring? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Security: Fault injection] Can fault injection attacks (like rowhammer) flip bits in InputSecret field values stored in memory, causing signature or key derivation failures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Security: Spectre/Meltdown] Can speculative execution vulnerabilities leak InputSecret values across security boundaries in multi-tenant validator environments? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Feature: assert-private-keys-not-cloneable] Can this feature flag be accidentally disabled in production builds, allowing InputSecret to be cloned and compromising single-owner security guarantees? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Feature: assert-private-keys-not-cloneable] Does the static assertion actually prevent Clone at compile time, or can unsafe code bypass it to clone secrets at runtime? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Compilation: Optimization levels] Can aggressive compiler optimizations eliminate security-critical operations like memory zeroing, causing secrets to remain in memory? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Compilation: Debug builds] Do debug builds disable the assert-private-keys-not-cloneable check, allowing secrets to be cloned during development testing? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Compilation: Cross-compilation] Can cross-compilation for different architectures introduce endianness or alignment bugs affecting InputSecret field element encoding? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Function: generate()] [Resource exhaustion] Can repeated calls to generate() exhaust RNG entropy or CPU resources, causing DoS during DKG ceremonies? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Function: add_assign()] [Computation DoS] Can malicious validators provide InputSecrets requiring expensive field operations, slowing down aggregation and causing consensus delays? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Function: to()] [Conversion DoS] Can adversarial public parameters cause the Convert::to() operation to become computationally expensive, causing verification delays? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Struct: InputSecret] [Memory DoS] Can InputSecret be instantiated with field types that consume excessive memory, enabling memory exhaustion attacks during DKG? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Function: is_zero()] [Repeated checks] Can repeatedly checking is_zero() on the same secret be used as a timing oracle to gradually leak information about the secret value? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Interop: Field compatibility] If different validators use different field implementations (different ark_ff backends), can field element incompatibilities cause DKG failures? (High)
